lead_paragraph: Putting people on antiretroviral drugs as soon as H.I.V. is detected can prolong lives. Do the will and resources exist to do so globally?

headline.print_headline: Treating H.I.V. Patients Before They Get Sick
headline.main: Treating H.I.V. Patients Before They Get Sick

snippet: Putting people on antiretroviral drugs as soon as H.I.V. is detected can prolong lives. Do the will and resources exist to do so globally?
abstract: Editorial welcomes major federal study finding that people infected with HIV should get treatment as soon as possible, regardless of how they feel; suggests study poses moral question of whether organizations around world can find will to protect millions who would benefit from this information; urges World Health Organization to recommend treatment for all infected people in updated treatment guidelines.
